Spore Queen Quilindra.description:
Hundreds of years ago, a cadre of powerful succubus assassins invaded the Abyssal realm of the demon lord of disease and fungus, Cyth-V'sug. These succubi sought to slay a powerful witch who had befouled a profane temple the assassins served. The succubi failed at their mission, but from their corpses grew the first fungus tyrants. Pleased with this development, the witch then seeded numerous worlds on the Material Plane with fungus tyrant spores, who have since grown and thrived in their new environments as rot thrives in a corpse. Today, hundreds of fungus tyrants inhabit the fouler locales of the Material Plane. They're particularly fond of large cave systems and ruined cities, but also can be found in corrupted woodlands where blighted fey rule or in the sewers of active cities that spew vast amounts of magical waste.

An encounter with a normally unintelligent plant monster acting with methodical intent can be evidence of a fungus tyrant's manipulations, but fungus tyrants are equally fond of keeping other types of creatures as pets and thralls—particularly attractive humanoids. Especially favored minions are given the gift of the fungus tyrant's embrace and are transformed into fungoid minions forever loyal to their pallid ruler. Yet most fungus tyrants realize that a diverse array of guardians is best, and they often choose to keep some non-fungus minions on hand to protect their lair.

Fungus tyrants are violently jealous. Any who attempt to lure away their dominated pets or cure those who have been infected by them earns their eternal ire. Yet it's succubi who enrage fungus tyrants the most. In these demons, the fungus tyrant sees a former glamour and power they no longer have access to, and only the brutal destruction of these mocking memories can salve a fungus tyrant's anger. A fungus tyrant faced with someone whom they suspect might be a succubus is terrible indeed, for in such battles, the fiendish fungal beings abandon their normal approach of subtle mental trickery and bring all of their power to bear in an attempt to rip the offending creature apart. Fungus tyrants also take great delight in transforming succubi into fungoid creatures under their control.

While their jealousy doesn't compel them to do battle with other fungus tyrants, they're always careful to maintain their own territories apart from any nearby kin, and they take great pains not to "poach" other tyrant's charmed and infested pets.

A fungus tyrant is 6 feet tall and weighs 150 pounds.

Spore Thralls

When a creature becomes a spore thrall, it rises from death with the same statistics it had in life, but gains the fungus trait, as well as immunity to death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, and poison, and its alignment switches to match that of the fungus tyrant who created them. When a spore thrall is slain, its soul finally travels to the Boneyard for judgment, but the fungus-encrusted physical remains often spawn new fungal creatures, such as myceloids, violet fungi, or drakauthixes. These fungal spawn are not controlled by the fungus tyrant but generally regard them as an ally or, more often, a divinity.

DE2HiFd3EjYr3JoX.description: The Spore Queen attempts a tentacle Strike but treats a sporepod or soul pod of her choice within 120 feet that she can see as the point of origin of that tentacle Strike.
DE2HiFd3EjYr3JoX.name: Sporewarp

QYEKw6Ao8ypo1VSm.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated rank.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of the spell at the listed rank.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
QYEKw6Ao8ypo1VSm.name: Wand of Phantasmal Calamity (Rank 8)

SIGvsx61oNnyWzLT.description:
The Spore Queen can create spawn from foes, but she doesn't use this ability in combat, as she would rather see the PCs dead than given this fungal gift.

If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by a fungus tyrant's Mind-Draining Kiss, the fungus tyrant can turn this victim into a spore thrall by donating some of their own fungal matter to the victim and leaving them to "ripen" within a patch of fungus for 24 hours. After this time, the creature is restored to life but gains the fungus trait and becomes a spore thrall. This prevents the creature's soul from continuing on to the afterlife in a similar manner to how undead are taken out of that cycle—as such, those who hold that cycle sacred (particularly worshipers of Pharasma) regard spore thralls as bad as the undead, despite them being living creatures. If the new spore thrall is a lower level than its creator, then it's under the creator's control. If a fungus tyrant controls too many spore thralls at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spore thralls can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|dc:28] save. Typically, a fungus tyrant avoids creating spore thralls out of fallen foes who are too powerful to control, for they're only too aware of the compulsion for revenge such victims might harbor for those who wrenched them from the afterlife.
SIGvsx61oNnyWzLT.name: Create Spawn

gaf17uTpbvO4KcPq.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Spore Queen engages a creature she's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in an act of passion in an attempt to drain its will. The kiss makes the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} or increases its stupefied condition by 1, to a maximum of 4. The creature takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and must then succeed at a @Check[will|dc:42] save or be affected by a suggestion to remain immobile rather than trying to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.
gaf17uTpbvO4KcPq.name: Mind-Draining Kiss

lgB1MU6GHJHRtB1m.description: The Spore Queen can speak with all forms of fungi. She gains a +3 circumstance bonus to all Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation checks made against fungal creatures.
lgB1MU6GHJHRtB1m.name: Fungaltongue

mGQswZHQ8ZgVEJWy.description: The Spore Queen Steps into an adjacent sporepod or non-destroyed soul pod (see area K) and instantly teleports to any other active sporepod or soul pod in the area, bursting out of the target pod and destroying it in the process.
mGQswZHQ8ZgVEJWy.name: Sporestride

mt6YPCJZaIlcVzZ8.description:
Quilindra remembers her failures in her previous life vividly. A PC can taunt her as an action with the auditory, concentrate, linguistic, and mental traits by attempting a @Check[deception|dc:40], @Check[diplomacy|dc:40], @Check[intimidation|dc:40], or @Check[performance|dc:40] check.

Critical Success Quilindra is significantly distracted; she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for the remainder of the encounter, becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of her next turn as she spends valuable moments sputtering and shrieking in rage at the PC. Additional critical successes increase the value of her stupefied condition by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}.

Success As critical success, but she's not stupefied and remains off-guard only until the end of her next turn.

Failure Quilindra is only slightly distracted and becomes off-guard to that PC until the end of the PC's turn.

Critical Failure Quilindra is unaffected.
mt6YPCJZaIlcVzZ8.name: Distracted by Failures

v1kBflFPb6tcyPK9.description: The Spore Queen inflicts an additional 2d6 spirit damage to elves she Strikes with her dagger. An elf reduced to 0 Hit Points by the Spore Queen's dagger Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} as Treerazer takes note of their soul.
v1kBflFPb6tcyPK9.name: Vengeful Slice

zTUk285orSz8VuBR.description: The Spore Queen causes a human-sized pod of fungal material to burst out of the ground at any point she can see within 60 feet. Once created, a sporepod lasts for 1 minute, until she moves more than 120 feet away from it, or until it's destroyed (AC 45, Hardness 20, 60 HP). She cannot Grow a Sporepod again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, but apart from this and a sporepod's 1 minute life, there is no hard limit to the number of sporepods she can have active at any one time.
zTUk285orSz8VuBR.name: Grow Sporepod

Spore Queen Quilindra.name: Spore Queen Quilindra
Spore Queen Quilindra.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Spore Stomach.description: A puffball-like fungus periodically vents gray spores into the air.
Spore Stomach.hazardDisable: @Check[nature|dc:37] (master) three times to carefully prune away the fungal roots that connect to the garden below, or @Check[religion|dc:37] (master) three times to exorcise the demonic energies from the fungus
Spore Stomach.hazardReset: The spore stomach deactivates if it starts a turn and there are no non-fungus creatures in area E1. It then immediately resets.
Spore Stomach.hazardRoutine: (1 action; divine, poison) On the first round, the spore stomach sprays a 40-foot-long cone of spores into the left half of area E1. On the second round, it sprays spores into the right half of area E1. On the third round, it takes no action. It repeats this pattern thereafter every 3 rounds. A creature in the area of spores takes @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic|traits:divine,poison] save).
Spore Stomach.name: Spore Stomach

4Cq1p27nn9mKwvRz.description: A spore thrall deals an additional 2d6 precision damage against a creature they've designated as their hunted prey.
4Cq1p27nn9mKwvRz.name: Precise Aim

ImzpAPq1SgMcf7t3.description: The spore thrall designates a single creature they can see or hear as their prey. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} their prey and ignore the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment against the prey they're hunting. If the spore thrall uses Hunt Prey against a creature when they already have one designated, the previous creature loses the designation. The designation lasts for 24 hours.
ImzpAPq1SgMcf7t3.name: Hunt Prey

eswnnzXSCS7W92iT.description: When a spore thrall is reduced to 0 Hit Points by damage other than cold damage, they burst in an explosion of toxic green spores. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] around the spore thrall take @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic] save).
eswnnzXSCS7W92iT.name: Spore Burst

Spore Tyrannosaurus.description:
Widely regarded as the king of the dinosaurs, the tyrannosaurus is a massive predator with a wide mouth filled with viciously sharp teeth. Some tribes of giants have even trained tyrannosauruses as mounts or beasts of war.

Remnants from the world's primeval era, these enormous reptilian animals still exist in large numbers in remote wildernesses or underground in magical Darklands caverns. Lizardfolk, orcs, giants, and other humanoids who live near dinosaurs use the animals as mounts, guards, or hunting beasts. Occasionally, rich nobles will collect dinosaurs to display them in menageries, which almost inevitably leads to cast-offs being nursed back to health by druids and other champions of nature. When dinosaurs establish themselves in regions outside their normal habitats, it's often the result of a large collection being released.

12NagAQPX82czuZ4.description: A spore tyrannosaur in contact with fungal corruption can sense the nearby motion of anything touching the same patch of fungal corruption.
12NagAQPX82czuZ4.name: Fungalsense

24g2FSPaGiTvJB6C.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the tyrannosaurus's jaws

Effect The tyrannosaurus flings the creature into the air up to 10 feet up from its mouth and 20 feet away. The creature falls 25 feet (assuming the tyrannosaurus flings it as high as it can) and takes falling damage accordingly. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage. The creature being landed on can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:33|basic] save.
24g2FSPaGiTvJB6C.name: Fling

9gYASQQf328TmVpW.description:
Trigger The tyrannosaurus critically hits a Large or smaller foe with its foot

Effect The creature struck by the foot is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and held in place. As long as the tyrannosaurus doesn't move from its position, the pinned creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

A tyrannosaurus gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack a creature it has pinned in this manner but can only Swallow Whole if that creature is grabbed with its jaws.
9gYASQQf328TmVpW.name: Pin Prey

aHZeRVDynG7BMq1x.description: While the spore tyrannosaurus is touching fungal corruption, it gains fast healing 10 and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}; it can use the extra action to Stride or Strike.
aHZeRVDynG7BMq1x.name: Fungal Empowerment

isAizYnvNaMLUqQd.description: 30 feet. Creatures that start their turn in the spore tyrannosaurus's aura are in danger of inhaling the toxic spores that it constantly exudes. Creatures without the fungus or plant trait take @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save) upon entering the aura or starting their turn in the aura. Those who fail are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} by the spores.
isAizYnvNaMLUqQd.name: Aura of Spores

raGz3FT0rBA5DRPc.description: The spore tyrannosaurus unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of highly toxic spores from its maw. Creatures in the area take @Damage[14d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). Those who fail are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). The fungal tyrannosaurus can't use the spore breath weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge the spore breath weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
raGz3FT0rBA5DRPc.name: Spore Breath

Spore Tyrannosaurus.name: Spore Tyrannosaurus

7u8sJ9qftjWaiy32.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The sporescout exudes a sticky layer of subversive spores onto their body. For 1 minute, any creature that touches the sporescout or damages them with an unarmed attack or melee weapon without the reach trait takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage as the spores infuse their thoughts with painful and subversive desires to offer servitude to Treerazer.
7u8sJ9qftjWaiy32.name: Cloak of Subversion

MW6uNbupIKPU9HQA.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The sporescout expels its infectious spores at a creature they can see within 20 feet. The target must immediately attempt a @Check[will|dc:31] save against the sporescout's infectious devotion. If the creature was already stupefied by infectious devotion, they instead become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} by the sporescout until the start of the sporescout's next turn.
MW6uNbupIKPU9HQA.name: Focus Spores

XbPhGtCj5ICaLRVb.description: A creature suffering from a fungal affliction takes a –2 status penalty on all saving throws against mental effects created by a sporescout and can always understand any language the sporescout speaks to them.
XbPhGtCj5ICaLRVb.name: Fungal Whisperer

YWgY6x4GVnSHF56N.description: A sporescout deals 1d6 extra precision damage and 1d6 persistent bleed damage to creatures who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.
YWgY6x4GVnSHF56N.name: Grisly Attack

h99k22ofuPTIlVCG.description: 20 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31] save (a plant or fungus takes a –2 circumstance penalty to this save). If the creature fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) as the fungus leshy's spores take root on the flesh and send unwelcome and distracting thoughts of devotion to Treerazer into the victim's mind.
h99k22ofuPTIlVCG.name: Infectious Devotion

Swamp Blight.description:
A swamp blight appears as a quivering blob of rancid brown and green mud from which dozens of hateful red eyes peer.

Blights are corruptions of nature's wrath.

Swampy Undead

While a swamp blight can dominate undead in its cursed domain, it prefers to use this power to gather and control undead that would prosper in a swampy environment. When building an encounter with a swamp blight, consider adjusting existing undead to match more thematically with the swampland environment, and avoid using undead that wouldn't make sense in such a region. Adjusting an undead creature's innate spells to be primal spells associated with swampy regions is a great way to achieve this customization.

4CSJKJuWyaBe59gQ.name: Nature's Pathway (At Will, Within Cursed Domain Only)

BLdkNidRdojGz90U.description: All blights can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} as an innate primal spell but can target only animals, beasts, fungi, oozes, plants, or undead that are located inside their cursed domain. If a creature dominated by this spell leaves the cursed domain, the effects of dominate immediately end, but as long as the dominated creature remains in the cursed domain, the duration is unlimited. When a blight targets a mindless fungi, ooze, or plant, its dominate spell loses the mental trait.
BLdkNidRdojGz90U.name: Blight Domination

Ek7f9vg0YLD3SmX7.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect An aura of glittering lights surrounds the swamp blight, compelling a target the swamp blight can see that's within 60 feet to move toward it. This is not forced movement and can compel creatures to move through dangerous terrain. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to Call of the Mire for 1 hour.

Success The target immediately Strides or otherwise uses their fastest Speed to approach the swamp blight. This movement does not cost the target their actions. On the target's next turn, they cannot willingly move farther away from the blight, but they can otherwise act normally.

Failure As success, except that the target spends all of their actions on their next turn also approaching the blight if they are not already adjacent, and they cannot take any other actions for 1 round. Additionally, the target cannot willingly move farther away from the blight for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, except that the creature's only actions are to approach the blight for 1 minute.
Ek7f9vg0YLD3SmX7.name: Call of the Mire

Hpnp9sOhmA6SZeqA.description:
Trigger A creature within 20 feet of the swamp blight deals damage to the blight

Effect The swamp blight violently expels putrefied organic matter at their attacker, making a decaying flesh Strike against them.
Hpnp9sOhmA6SZeqA.name: Putrefied Expulsion

LuAy4QdolmpZrOfg.description:
Humanoid creatures that die in a swamp blight's cursed domain are infused with void energy. After 24 hours, they rise as undead creatures of their level of lower. Creatures whose bodies were intact typically become zombies or mummies, while those whose bodies were severely damaged typically rise as shadows or bhutas. These undead are not automatically under the swamp blight's direct control, but they can potentially be dominated by the swamp blight.

Once per year, when in a terrain that is compatible with its type (such as a swamp for a swamp blight), the blight can infuse the land around it with its corrupted essence by performing a rite that takes one day. The region in a 5-mile radius becomes its cursed domain; this effect does not extend into incompatible terrain and does not move with the blight. The point at which the blight cursed the domain becomes its epicenter.

Within their cursed domain, a blight ignores all non-magical difficult terrain and always gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{Cover Tracks} action. Blights also have an imprecise sense for the locations of all creatures within their domain and can communicate with all sapient creatures they detect within their domain using telepathy. Each blight's cursed domain has additional properties specific to the blight's type. A blight outside of a cursed domain becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it returns to its own or another blight's cursed domain.

Removing this curse requires a character with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.zGrUu3dUtqHrqGuo]{Break Curse} feat (or a similar ability); this activity must be performed at the cursed domain's epicenter. If the blight that cursed the domain is dead, checks to counteract a cursed domain gain a +4 circumstance bonus.
LuAy4QdolmpZrOfg.name: Cursed Domain

MIe6z3p4TMVFmAaU.description:
30 feet. Mosquitoes surround the blight. The mosquitoes ignore creatures the blight designates as allies as well as any who are at full HP. All other creatures who enter the aura or begin their turn within it take @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:35] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
MIe6z3p4TMVFmAaU.name: Mosquito Aura

a6tGUz3QzuHcYSJA.description: Targets hit by a decaying flesh Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). This condition is cumulative with itself and with the sickened condition from the mosquito aura, up to a maximum value of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4}. If the Strike critically hits, the target also takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage.
a6tGUz3QzuHcYSJA.name: Splatter Viscera

Swamp Blight.name: Swamp Blight

Tangle Khravgodon.description:
Few creatures can shrug off an ankhrav's acid and crunch its chitin like a khravgodon.

Few creatures have survived as long and in as many environments as the opossum.

7c1InSV9VXV4cB8Z.description: A khravgodon can drag a Large or smaller creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its tail along with it when it Strides.
7c1InSV9VXV4cB8Z.name: Grasping Tail

M7bSwayItCZu1H43.description:
Requirements The khravgodon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The khravgodon bites the creature, dealing @Damage[(2d12+9)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save) that ignores the first 5 of the target's Hardness or resistance to physical damage. On a failed save, the target also takes a -2 circumstance penalty to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7OJrBAEah6YFLzcK]{Effect: Crush Chitin}
M7bSwayItCZu1H43.name: Crush Chitin

sM1MA3hKVxt7ZvXp.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Disease

Tangle Khravgodon.name: Tangle Khravgodon
Tangle Khravgodon.npcAllSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

TA1sQhusAvQaJjnY.description:
The bhuta takes the form of a Large, Medium, or Small animal common to their bound area. This doesn't change the bhuta's Speed or attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal. No matter what form the bhuta takes, their feet remain backward and they cast no shadow. A bhuta in animal form is still incorporeal, though that isn't obvious just by looking at it.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

blRax867OLdVUMwk.name: Nature's Enmity (Only While Within the Tar Root's Cursed Domain)

j0godn9ynpr21ye8.description: The bhuta attempts to possess an adjacent animal. They cast 9th-rank heightened @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} with the following changes: since the bhuta has no physical body, they're unaffected by that restriction. On a critical failure, the duration extends to 1 full day. While possessed by a bhuta, the animal casts no shadow.
j0godn9ynpr21ye8.name: Possess Animal

ngnwinz7rvkh1cvw.description: Bhutas are bound to a natural area or feature where they died and must remain within @Template[emanation|distance:120]{120 feet} of that anchor. A bhuta can only leave if invited to travel with living companions, an invitation bhutas often seek to obtain via trickery. While traveling, the bhuta must remain within 120 feet of at least one of the living creatures who invited them. If all members of the group die, the bhuta must return to their bound area by midnight the same day or be destroyed.
ngnwinz7rvkh1cvw.name: Bound

ww6g31ronygtiit4.description: A bhuta corrupts wildlife near their bound area, worming their way into animals' minds. Animals who live within the bound area take a -4 circumstance penalty to saves against the bhuta's Possess Animal ability, the bhuta's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} innate spell, and the bhuta's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aIHY2DArKFweIrpf]{Command} innate spell.
ww6g31ronygtiit4.name: Primal Corruption

Tanglebriar Creeper.description: The monstrous, bloated spiders from the windswept realm of Leng build eerie, dangerous lairs with the aid of magically compelled slaves. Leng spiders have anywhere from five to 13 legs, but never an even number.

0hkOF2WHkLhHAEjQ.description:
The Leng spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count when calculating falling damage.

The web can be severed by a Strike that deals slashing damage (AC 30, Hardness 15, 25 HP), causing the Leng spider to fall.
0hkOF2WHkLhHAEjQ.name: Descend on a Web

iZxDrmolCkhIxWO6.description: A Leng spider can use a web bola to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a target with the Athletics skill. The skill check takes a -2 circumstance penalty. A web bola deals no damage when used to Trip.
iZxDrmolCkhIxWO6.name: Ranged Trip

iw7xcu7OkpYHYyQ2.description: While touching its webs, the Leng spider has precise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
iw7xcu7OkpYHYyQ2.name: Greater Web Sense

k4tbzCH8jMb0d1Qk.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 round); the confused effect has the emotion and mental traits.
k4tbzCH8jMb0d1Qk.name: Leng Spider Venom

sWbaqjXgO4EigI5j.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The Leng spider spins a web within 20 feet of itself to create a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TFnr9Gq7VXPJu0GQ]{Grasping Snare}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.a2XaerM1KkPyLIPM]{Stunning Snare}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XU8u9F3uoesGDjgM]{Warning Snare}. The Leng spider's web provides all the raw materials it needs. All save and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DCs associated with web traps use the Leng spider's Crafting DC for traps (DC 43). A web trap decays after 24 hours.
sWbaqjXgO4EigI5j.name: Lay Web Trap

snsO2nPGYHe6pZx0.description:
The Leng spider creates a weapon by applying a cord of webbing to heavy objects, such as rocks or chunks of metal, either attaching two heavy objects together to create a web bola or fastening one to its leg to create a web war flail.

Any melee weapon created by a Tanglebriar creeper also becomes saturated with toxin and inflicts an additional 1d6 poison damage on a hit.
snsO2nPGYHe6pZx0.name: Create Web Weaponry

Tanglebriar Creeper.name: Tanglebriar Creeper
Tanglebriar Creeper.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Tanglebriar Isqulug.description: The isqulug's appearance, though unsettling, might be its least awful aspect. The creature resembles a bipedal amphibian with tentacles instead of arms and a head composed of an undulant mass of what appear to be shifting, slimy transparent eggs filled with writhing larvae. In truth, these larvae constitute the mind and consciousness of the isqulug-its "body" is little more than an organic suit manufactured from the flesh of those it has consumed, analogous to the complex web of a spider or the hive of a colony of bees, but fully capable of movement and violence.

CwEVrNGC8oHJQrv0.description:
Isqulugia's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} conditions can't be removed until this affliction is removed

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 hour)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 paralyzed (1 day)

Stage 5 the creature dies, and its body violently transforms into a new isqulug. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, similar magic, or a 9th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual can return the victim to life. The new isqulug remains even if the victim is brought back to life.
CwEVrNGC8oHJQrv0.name: Isqulugia

GRiHxWvHx9rf0zcF.description:
The isqulug expels larvae from the hivemind in its head in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[6d10[piercing]] damage as the swarm feeds on their flesh (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). Any creature that takes damage is exposed to isqulugia.

The isqulug becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Stupified Duration]]{1d4 rounds}, during which it can't Expel Infestation.
GRiHxWvHx9rf0zcF.name: Expel Infestation

WtMCu7aRag8Z4ewh.description: An isqulug ignores difficult terrain that's caused by typical features of swamps.
WtMCu7aRag8Z4ewh.name: Swamp Stride

fRwko0nbFXXeMXfH.description:
Trigger The Tanglebriar isqulug is hit by a melee attack

Effect The Tanglebriar isqulug unleashes a cloud of toxic spores that burrow into the skin of any living nonfungus creature that is adjacent to them. The spores deal @Damage[2d6[persistent,poison]] damage, and as long as the damage persists, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} from the numbness caused by the spores.
fRwko0nbFXXeMXfH.name: Spore Cloud

swAJMaqujVUFqFKT.description: An isqulug can precisely sense any creature infected with isqulugia within 30 feet, and knows the current stage of the disease.
swAJMaqujVUFqFKT.name: Host Scent

u3s5y4pE6L6HfEAq.description: The isqulug can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through tight spaces as if it were a Small creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed. The isqulug can even Squeeze through spaces that typically fit only a Tiny creature, but does so at the standard speed for Squeezing.
u3s5y4pE6L6HfEAq.name: Malleability

Tanglebriar Isqulug.name: Tanglebriar Isqulug

Tanglebriar Regent.description:
Arboreal regents are lumbering, solitary creatures responsible for guarding an entire forest. They take an especially long view of affairs and never act brashly or without much deliberation. They occasionally come together in small groups called groves to share news and pass their wisdom down to the arboreal wardens that have sprouted under their watch. In times of grave danger, all the groves in a region may gather for a great months-long meeting to plan and, eventually, act upon a threat.

The typical arboreal regent is 30 feet tall, has a trunk 2 feet in diameter, and weighs 4,500 pounds.

Arboreals are guardians of the forest and representatives of the trees. As long-lived as the woods they watch over, arboreals consider themselves parents and shepherds of trees rather than their gardeners. Consequently, while arboreals tend to be slow and methodical, they are terrifyingly swift when forced to fight in defense of the woods. Though they rarely seek out the companionship of short-lived folk—even elves are fugacious in the eyes of arboreals—and have an inherent distrust of change, arboreals have been known to tolerate those who seek to learn from their long-winded, rambling monologues, especially if such pupils also express a desire to protect the timberlands. Against those who threaten their realm, such as loggers eager to harvest lumber or settlers aiming to establish croplands or a town, arboreals' wrath is unwavering and devastating. Perhaps ironically, arboreals are gifted at tearing down what others build—a trait that serves vengeful members of their kind well.

AGXK0KxxfZSzKqKk.description: When an arboreal regent damages an item or structure, it deals an additional [[/r {2d10}]]{2d10 damage} to that item or structure.
AGXK0KxxfZSzKqKk.name: Sunder Objects

mYx5idAG87aEyIii.description: The Tanglebriar regent sprays a blast of spores from their body, dealing @Damage[14d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic] save). They can't use spore spray again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge spore spray]]{1d4 rounds}.
mYx5idAG87aEyIii.name: Spore Spray

Tanglebriar Regent.name: Tanglebriar Regent

The Putrid.description:
The catoblepas is an aggressive beast at the best of times. Though it prefers swamps, the catoblepas has been know to forage in plains and forests for short periods, leaving behind hunting grounds tainted by its foul breath and noxious waste that other predators and prey alike avoid for days or even weeks thereafter. The catoblepas bullies those creatures it believes are a match for it, and eats everything weaker.

A catoblepas is 15 feet long and weighs 2,200 pounds.

SC8cOsvopK2TY1o0.description:
Trigger A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} creature within 10 feet of the Putrid takes poison damage

Effect The Putrid darts her head out to lick the poisoned creature, exposing the creature to tanglerot. The Putrid gains 30 Temporary Hit Points if the target fails their saving throw against tanglerot.
SC8cOsvopK2TY1o0.name: Quicken the Rot

VDW4W2k1N88INhBp.description: The Putrid exhales a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] of rotten spores and fumes, dealing @Damage[16d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect] save). The area of this cone is reduced to 30 feet underwater. Targets that fail their saving throw also become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure) and are exposed to tanglerot. The Putrid can't use Putrid Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Putrid Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
VDW4W2k1N88INhBp.name: Putrid Breath

x8pzzu8VRuRa5sdg.description:
30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as itʼs sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
x8pzzu8VRuRa5sdg.name: Stench

The Putrid.name: The Putrid

Tithekeeper.description:
Razmir's most powerful priests deploy tithekeepers to ensure his followers don't develop sticky fingers. These ziggurat-like constructs have over two dozen legs and a trap-like mouth. At its top, a mask with a colored ribbon attached denotes its symbolic rank in the Church of Razmir.

Instruments of Terror

Though the tithekeeper's primary function is to collect coins, they're capable of great violence. Priests who determine a village is too far behind on payments might have their tithekeeper skewer multiple residents and wave its victims' bodies in the air as it parades through the streets. Those who survive the ordeal are highly motivated to avoid a repeat experience.

2k7t0cZJVWfjCoCL.description: A creature wearing the mask and garb of a priest of Razmir that outranks the tithekeeper's mask and ribbon rank can spend an hour Interacting with the tithekeeper's mask to connect with it. The creature's mask becomes an invested item that allows them to see and hear as though peering through the tithekeeper's mask. The creature must use a 3-action activity envisioning the tithekeeper to activate the scrying effect, and the effect can be Dismissed. Multiple creatures can create connections to the tithekeeper's mask simultaneously, and a creature can have connections to multiple tithekeepers with just one mask. Each connection ends after a week but can be renewed at any time.
2k7t0cZJVWfjCoCL.name: Eyes Behind the Mask

S6muXnYVqd6xPoYs.description:
Requirements The tithekeeper has Impaled a creature

Effect The tithekeeper tears the creature loose from its spiky feet, releasing it. The creature takes @Damage[4d10[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic] save) and is no longer @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. On a failed save, the creature also takes @Damage[2d8[persistent,bleed]] damage.
S6muXnYVqd6xPoYs.name: Rip Off

UEN6QlyeiPOycfoa.description: The tithekeeper's body is a locked vault containing any tithes given to it. The vault's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Lock} DC is 29 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} DC is 33.
UEN6QlyeiPOycfoa.name: Locked Vault

UfNYMzlG9vSoNKRd.description:
Trigger A creature drops or offers at least 750 gp in valuables within 15 feet of the tithekeeper

Effect The tithekeeper quickly uses its feet to scoop the valuables into its vault and is now indifferent toward the triggering creature unless that creature uses hostile actions against it or its allies.
UfNYMzlG9vSoNKRd.name: Accept Tithe

UwthgNFhzVYfkzkK.description: The tithekeeper can have up to six creatures impaled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its feet at once.
UwthgNFhzVYfkzkK.name: Capacity for Punishment

WseMJaoN35TNcgzl.description:
Requirements The tithekeeper has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} a creature

Effect The tithekeeper stabs the target with a spike for @Damage[(2d8+13)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). It no longer has to spend an action to extend the duration for the target it has grabbed. The target moves with the tithekeeper and takes @Damage[1d8[persistent,bleed]] damage until it Escapes (DC 29).
WseMJaoN35TNcgzl.name: Impale

Tithekeeper.name: Tithekeeper

Ulugurnix.description:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

1FbPUVt1mVdHjwrB.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede their progress.
1FbPUVt1mVdHjwrB.name: Forest Passage

3Fn7wuVzeuI4kT5H.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.
3Fn7wuVzeuI4kT5H.name: Impaling Charge

7l6OIo3lkrYm0wAz.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature is within the ghoul's reach

Effect The ghoul whispers dark thoughts and vile cravings into the creature's ears. The creature must save against the forbidden cravings curse.

Forbidden Cravings (curse) A creature can still eat and drink while sickened by this curse

Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:30|traits:curse], using the high spell DC for the ghoul's level

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} until it consumes raw meat (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2

Stage 4 as stage 2 unless the target has consumed raw meat in the past 24 hours, then it takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until it consumes raw meat;

Stage 5 if the creature has eaten raw meat in the past 24 hours, it dies and rises as a ghoul, if not, it returns to stage 4
7l6OIo3lkrYm0wAz.name: Ghoul Whispers

8BzH2B4bDUBJMWb0.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The ghoul calls upon knowledge it retains from one creature it has consumed in the past 7 days. The ghoul attempts a skill check using a skill in which the consumed creature was trained (if it's unclear whether the creature was trained, the GM decides). The ghoul is treated as trained and uses a +23 modifier. This takes the same amount of actions or time as usual for the check.

The ghoul can instead automatically learn something specific known by a creature it consumed in the last 7 days, like the location of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} treasure or the name of a loved one. The ghoul can do this only once for a given creature, no matter how much of its flesh the ghoul consumed.
8BzH2B4bDUBJMWb0.name: Grave Knowledge

ItyDWQiPz0eJ2hOb.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.
ItyDWQiPz0eJ2hOb.name: Twisting Tail

Iv8LMCTGw5NLD5aD.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horn Strike in any order.
Iv8LMCTGw5NLD5aD.name: Draconic Frenzy

VPryni3E3RGw5MdV.description: Ulugurnix breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[12d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save). He can't use Poison Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
VPryni3E3RGw5MdV.name: Poison Breath

XhU4mCNUkX4dqLS7.description: The dragon recharges their Poison Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.
XhU4mCNUkX4dqLS7.name: Draconic Momentum

kmoO5nM9lLiCvPNn.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[6d6[healing]] Hit Points.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
kmoO5nM9lLiCvPNn.name: Consume Flesh

Ulugurnix.name: Ulugurnix

Unrisen Slithermaw.description:
An unrisen is a mangled conglomeration of splintered bones, decaying organs, and rotting flesh, created when a ritual such as resurrect goes catastrophically wrong. Immense care must be taken, for if the ritual is a critical failure, an unrisen can be the result—as many a ritualist has learned to their horror.

Unrisen are barely intelligent, aware only of the agony constantly inflicted by their flawed creation and their resentment for the living. They tend to attack the casters involved in the botched ritual first before lashing out at everyone else around them. Though an unrisen's twisted form is unrecognizable as the intended target of the resurrection, its wordless howls are often disturbingly similar to the deceased's voice. If an unrisen is destroyed before it can rise again, it's reduced to a handful of metallic blue-green salts referred to as essential salts.

5q62z2h5hdchg2s2.description: The unrisen reshapes its grotesque form to move swiftly. It Strides twice. Any living creature that can see the unrisen during this movement must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). This is a mental and visual effect. The unrisen can't use Awful Approach again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Awful Approach]]{1d4 rounds}.
5q62z2h5hdchg2s2.name: Awful Approach

5tla19582bslvej5.description:
Requirements The unrisen has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The unrisen attempts to destroy its victim's life force to share the unrisen's fate. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. While the curse lasts, the creature regains only half as many HP from vitality healing effects; if it dies, any attempt to raise it from the dead causes it to return as an unrisen. The curse ends automatically if the creature's doomed value is reduced to 0.
5tla19582bslvej5.name: Death Grip

7Bc2miXbngRIkwqz.description: The unrisen Slithermaw breathes out a toxic cloud of foul vapor from its heads in all directions at once. Creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take @Damage[15d8[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). The unrisen Slithermaw can't use Poisonous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Poisonous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
7Bc2miXbngRIkwqz.name: Poisonous Breath

8h5yhlk6yupldtxp.description: A creature with a prepared or spontaneous spell that can restore the dead to life (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Hnc7eGi7vyZenAIm]{Breath of Life} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead}) can expend an appropriate spell slot as a 2-action activity to destroy an unrisen within 30 feet. The attempt fails if the unrisen succeeds at a Will save against the creature's spell DC.
8h5yhlk6yupldtxp.name: Resurrection Vulnerability

KEs9dIIUbepZi7hA.description:
The unrisen Slithermaw gains 12 extra reactions per round beyond its first, which it can only use to make Reactive Strikes. He can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares on the same triggering action.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]
KEs9dIIUbepZi7hA.name: Reactive Strike (Special)

NPVcj98IkMtcgWQ8.description: If a PC wears @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.9DuwR6Z1P5PuQwS3]{Slithermaw's Bane}, the unrisen Slithermaw focuses his attacks on that PC. A PC who wears Slithermaw's Bane is immune to all poison damage caused by the unrisen Slithermaw. Whenever such a PC scores a critical hit on the unrisen Slithermaw, the undead hydra becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The unrisen Slithermaw is not immune to poison inflicted by Slithermaw's Bane when Calistria's Sting is activated and in fact has weakness 15 to this poison damage.
NPVcj98IkMtcgWQ8.name: Slithermaw's Bane

hMgg4SgBOxSwlBlZ.description: The unrisen Slithermaw makes up to 12 jaws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward his multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after he makes all of his attacks.
hMgg4SgBOxSwlBlZ.name: Storm of Jaws

mlytlp3vwdiv4xev.description: If the unrisen Slithermaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points by means other than fire damage, disintegration, damage caused by a character wearing Slithermaw's Bane, or his resurrection vulnerability, he returns to unlife at the start of his next turn. He has 150 Hit Points and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the space in which he was destroyed. He can't be returned to unlife by this ability again for 1 hour.
mlytlp3vwdiv4xev.name: Rise Again

mx6sscnvhtaiutid.description: Whenever an unrisen would take damage from vitality energy, it instead heals half that number of Hit Points.
mx6sscnvhtaiutid.name: Meant to Live

Unrisen Slithermaw.name: Unrisen Slithermaw

5k4E1L7oi69CoIfM.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated rank.

Craft Requirements Supply a casting of the spell at the listed rank.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
5k4E1L7oi69CoIfM.name: Wand of Lightning Bolt (Rank 5) (Stored in Retrieval Belt)

8OmBZyt7RzzFHAQm.description: Vintalax is driven forward by a singular, otherworldly will, guiding their actions. Whenever Vintalax attempts a Will saving throw against a mental effect that would control or dictate their actions, Vintalax treats the result of the saving throw as one category better.
8OmBZyt7RzzFHAQm.name: Otherworldly Will

CTxuUvk7zPwfXMqc.description: Vintalax drives his tentacles into the ground, causing tendrils of fungus to erupt everywhere in area B9. This deals @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning],3d6[acid]]{2d8 bludgeoning damage plus 3d6 acid} damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save). Creatures that fail their save against tentacle eruption are grasped by the tendrils, reducing their speed by 10 feet until the start of Vintalax's next turn (or are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} on a critical failure).
CTxuUvk7zPwfXMqc.name: Tentacle Eruption

DrNIeMG6xhBE6L50.description: Vintalax is attached to his throne by a twisted length of thorny fungal vines that limit his mobility to areas B9 and B10. This tether can be destroyed (AC 30, Hardness 12, HP 50 (BT 25), Immunities acid, bludgeoning; Resistances piercing 10), in which case Vintalax howls in pain as his body rapidly begins to decay. Each round that he remains severed from the throne he loses his fast healing and takes @Damage[4d6[spirit]] damage at the start of his turn, but his AC increases to 36 and his speed to 25 feet, due to his increased mobility. He can end this effect by sitting back down on his throne (an Interact action) and remaining there until the end of his turn, at which point a new fungus tether reattaches to him.
DrNIeMG6xhBE6L50.name: Throne Tethered

H9TM1MMKor3xpYry.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:34]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 stupefied 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 drained 1 and controlled by the Rotting God (1 day)

Stage 5 controlled by the Rotting God (1 day)

Stage 6 the creature becomes permanently controlled by the Rotting God (and may gain unique fungus-themed abilities)—at this point the creature is no longer diseased, and the control can only be ended by the death of the Rotting God or by an effect that removes curses. The creature loses any fungus-themed abilities granted by rotting gift as soon as it's removed.
H9TM1MMKor3xpYry.name: Rotting Gift

Qn6ZA6ChMs6fMitE.description: Vintalax unleashes a cloud of spores from his mouth in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[12d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect] save). Those who fail this save are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure) as the spores enter their lungs and begin to grow. These creatures take @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage as long as they remain sickened. This bleed damage cannot be stopped as long as the sickened condition persists. Any creature that takes damage from spore breath is exposed to rotting gift.
Qn6ZA6ChMs6fMitE.name: Spore Breath

eyikGGHRDaETtUqe.description:
Trigger Vintalax takes damage from a melee Strike made by an adjacent creature

Effect Vintalax's corrupted body unleashes a cloud of spores that envelopes the attacker, quickly growing and dissolving their flesh. These spores deal @Damage[4d6[persistent,poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic] save).
eyikGGHRDaETtUqe.name: Spore Burst

z9mr7stUuG0whoF7.name: Potion of Fire Resistance (Moderate) (Stored in Retrieval Belt)

Vintalax, The Rotting God.name: Vintalax, The Rotting God
Vintalax, The Rotting God.npcSpeed: (25 feet when not attached to the throne)

Vixivax.description:
An invidiak has no physical body and is born out of a deep sense of envy over this lack. An invidiak only feels properly "alive" when they're possessing a host. In many cases, an invidiak remains dormant in such a host, spending months, even years, observing from within and building up its influence over the host slowly, so as to cause as much long-lasting despair and emotional trauma to the host's friends and family as possible.

Lengthy Possessions

An invidiak can possess a favored host for an unlimited amount of time, and over the course of years their influence can result in their host gaining strange new and unique supernatural powers that grow from this spiritual corruption. Such powers only function as long as the possession lasts; if the invidiak is forced out of the body, these powers vanish and don't return, even if the invidiak later re-possesses the same host. These unique invidiaks are generally much more powerful than the typical one presented here.

OJg4VMV8aMk40kBm.description: The invidiak Strides up to twice their speed. If the invidiak ends their movement in an area of dim light, they become hidden as long as they don't move and the lighting in the area they're in doesn't grow brighter than dim light.
OJg4VMV8aMk40kBm.name: Shadow Blend

TtqhvUO0vvhjbIFp.description:
If an invidiak attempts to possess a creature and the creature rolls a critical success on its saving throw to resist @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}, or if an invidiak's possession of a creature is ended prematurely, such as via a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, the invidiak takes @Damage[9d6[mental]] damage and cannot use possession for 24 hours.

See Iravalinn's Fight for Control reaction.
TtqhvUO0vvhjbIFp.name: Exorcism Vulnerability

fDEMKsDuC7SNDbx6.description: Vixivax leaves no body behind when using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}.
fDEMKsDuC7SNDbx6.name: Unbodied Possession

tIiXnBCscCuQi4WY.description:
Vixivax's favored hosts are elves.

Each invidiak has a type of creature they prefer possessing, chosen from aberration, animal, beast, or any humanoid (such as dwarf, elf, or human)—in most cases, the favored type of target is human. When an invidiak casts possession on a favored host, the duration of possession increases to unlimited, and the effect lasts until dispelled or until the invidiak dismisses it.
tIiXnBCscCuQi4WY.name: Favored Host

zBhbPtqzK6B5JjcX.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the invidiak deals damage to the invidiak

Effect An echo of the invidiak's pain lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing an amount of nonlethal mental damage equal to half the damage the invidiak took from the triggering attack (@Check[will|dc:33|basic] save). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.
zBhbPtqzK6B5JjcX.name: Share Pain

Vixivax.name: Vixivax

Withermold.description: Coils of pale yellow thorny fungal vines on which grow hundreds of brown puffballs suddenly whip into frenzied life.
Withermold.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:33] (master) twice to exorcise the unholy presence within the withermold, or @Check[survival|dc:35] (master) twice to safely remove the sensory tendrils growing in the mold
Withermold.hazardReset: A withermold deactivates at the end of any round when there are no targets within reach to attack with thorny vine Strikes. It resets immediately unless it's used all its Spore Burst reactions for the day, in which case the withermold resets in 24 hours.
Withermold.hazardRoutine: (3 actions) A withermold makes three Strikes with its thorny vines on its turn, splitting its Strikes up among potential targets before striking a single target more than once.
Withermold.name: Withermold

Zauglagaul.description:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.

1FbPUVt1mVdHjwrB.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede their progress.
1FbPUVt1mVdHjwrB.name: Forest Passage

2y5PjoJxmfA6wGl8.description:
20 feet. After the dragon uses their Poison Breath, a cloud of poison gas continues to emanate from their body for 1 round. Any creature that ends its turn in the miasma takes @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:39|basic] save).

Any creature in the miasma is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and treats other creatures as concealed. The dragon can see through this concealment.
2y5PjoJxmfA6wGl8.name: Miasma

3Fn7wuVzeuI4kT5H.description:
Requirements The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Effect The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.
3Fn7wuVzeuI4kT5H.name: Impaling Charge

DH9dqEVVGTZe7G9s.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Primal

I0wNsm5MwUO1PaPN.description: After Zuldanavox nearly bit off Zauglagaul's right wing decades ago, it never quite healed right. A crescent-shaped patch of discolored scales at the base of his wing on his right side marks this wound. The PCs might already know about this wound (see Zauglagaul at a Disadvantage below); otherwise, a PC only learns about this weakness if they witness a critical hit against Zauglagaul that inflicts piercing damage. Once a PC knows about Zauglagaul's old wound, they can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} during their turn to focus on this old wound, automatically treating Zauglagaul as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of their next turn. If a PC critically hits Zauglagaul in the same round they Seek in this way, the pain causes the dragon to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 hour. Multiple critical hits can increase the value of these conditions up to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 4}.
I0wNsm5MwUO1PaPN.name: Old Wound

ItyDWQiPz0eJ2hOb.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.
ItyDWQiPz0eJ2hOb.name: Twisting Tail

O3Pp2Vb15TQKafR0.description: The horned dragon always gains the benefits of Cover Tracks in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.
O3Pp2Vb15TQKafR0.name: Trackless Journey

VPryni3E3RGw5MdV.description:
Zauglagaul breathes a toxic cloud of spores that deals @Damage[18d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save. Zauglagaul can't use Spore Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spore Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for an unlimited duration as the spores take root and cause the victim to suffer from distracting hallucinations.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for an unlimited duration.
VPryni3E3RGw5MdV.name: Spore Breath

lseWqsEmPmayLsqf.description: Zauglagaul can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in exterior locations in Tanglebriar even if he doesn't have cover.
lseWqsEmPmayLsqf.name: Camouflage

wqTR4ozN25T6OJlA.description: Mist and fog (such as the Haze) doesn't impair Zauglagaul's vision; he ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from mist and fog.
wqTR4ozN25T6OJlA.name: Mist Vision

Zauglagaul.name: Zauglagaul
Zauglagaul.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. primal
